attributes.additional_details: Only the crowned ruler-either the king or the queen-has the had title "Your Majesty" so far, where as the consort was called "Your Royal Highness."  From now on, please change that so that both the king and the queen are addressed as "His Majesty and Her Majesty." If the next ruler is a male, then a female should also be coronated alongside of him and be named as "Her Majesty the Queen" not merely "Queen consort." This move will bring Great Britain into the same footing as the rest of the world in terms of feminism; otherwise, it is sexist! This form of female discrimination explains why English women have colonized other countries in an effort to feel important alongside their brothers and several working women complain of the glass ceiling. I also keenly observed that this form of “Male led” workplace is the root cause of the class system where several lower class women are without a feminist leader at their disposal all the time to alleviate all of their burdens.
